data.title: 62 Birthplace of former Prime Minister John G. Diefenbaker 42nd Parliament, 1st Session
data.meta_description: M-62 Birthplace of former Prime Minister John G. Diefenbaker 42nd Parliament, 1st Session - Members of Parliament - House of Commons of Canada
data.text: That, in the opinion of the House, the government should: (a) accept the offer of the donation of the birthplace of former Prime Minister John G. Diefenbaker in Neustadt, Ontario, by the owner of the property; (b) designate the property as a national historic site; (c) undertake any necessary restorations so as to operate the location as a museum; and (d) use the site to educate the public on the life of Canada’s first Prime Minister from a background other than English or French and commemorate the impact of this figure on Canada’s heritage.
